choices.text:
### Human:
Harmony used discarded paper to make notepads for her friends. She would fold five letter size pieces of paper three times then cut along the lines. She would then stack the smaller note papers and staple them together. How long would one notepad last if someone wrote ten notes per day?
### Assistant:

One note pad made from recycled paper with a thickness of 0.5 cm, folded five times and stapled will have an area of (3/2) x A = 3A/4 where A is the original surface area of one sheet of letter-sized paper which is approximately 10.16 cm². 
If someone writes ten notes per day on this note pad, then in one year they would write: 

10 notes / day * 365 days / year = 3750 notes written over a period of 1 year  

The number of pages that can be written before the staples break is determined by how many sheets are stacked together. Since each page has ten notes and there are five pages in total, then one note pad will last for: 

5 x 10 / 5 = 2 years or 12 months if someone writes a new set of notes every month  

Therefore, one human-made recycled paper notepad made from discarded newspaper can hold about 3750 pieces written over the course of 1 year.<|im_end|>
